Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 04:17 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers made partial repairs to a fault on the underground network in the South Farm Road area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 3 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 04:12 - We want to reassure you that we've certainly not forgotten about you and we know that the estimated time frame has now passed. Getting you an update is our priority, as we know it's important that you have the latest information.

Our team on site are still working, and we are liaising with them to get a progress update to you as soon as we can safely do so. As soon as we hear from them we'll be in touch, or you can call us on 105 if you need any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 02:17 - Our digging team are progressing well with excavations. Excavations can sometimes take longer than expected, depending on ground conditions, other utility equipment like gas and water pipes, parked vehicles, or local traffic.

At the moment our estimated time frame of 03:00-04:00 hasn't changed, but as our staff are busy working with live electricity we need to wait until they can safely stop work and contact us with the latest information. Once they do, we'll update you further.

Our team are always here if you have any questions.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 17:42 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers repair a fault on the underground network in the Whippendell Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power for a long time can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut today, our staff will work to restore your power as quickly and as safely as possible. A lot of our customers have questions regarding power cuts, and though you can always reach our team, you can also find some helpful information and answers to some of our most frequently asked questions on our website here - https://UKPN.short.gy/FAQ - Bear in mind this will use your mobile data, so feel free to speak to us if you'd prefer. We'll be in touch again once we have more information from our staff.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us that they have located the underground fault and excavations are being carried out.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 18:30-19:30 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Decasta at 15:18.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 04:04 - Hi David here again. I'm sorry for how long you were without power for and for losing power again on the same day.  We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to safely repair a faulty piece of underground electrical equipment in the WD23 4 area.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi David here again. We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by David at 03:23
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:

Sent by Decasta at 19:47 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to 158 customers in the Great Yarmouth NR29 3 area to safely repair repair a fault on the network.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

Our staff have found a potentially dangerous situation involving a fault on our overhead network so have responded as quickly as possible and asked our control room to turn power off to the area using our high voltage network. This is why a wide area has lost electricity.

Our field teams are working to fix the issue as quickly as possible, and we'll start diverting power back to affected homes as soon as they advise us it's safe. You may notice your lights going on and off as we work to get as much power restored as we can.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

Sent by Decasta at 16:34 - Our staff have now managed to restore power back to the Tilehouse Street SG5 1/2 area again.

They have thoroughly investigated our network equipment in the area, but the underlying network fault has not yet developed to a point for it to appear on any of their diagnostic tests. As such, they have replaced our substation equipment to restore power as quickly as possible.

I'm sorry this affected your power again today. This may happen again before we're able to pinpoint the issue and fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about anything or if your power isn't on, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Tilehouse Street SG5 1/2 area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frameto restore power is between 19:00-20:00, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. Logs.Comment:
Sent by Kevin at 19:51 - We can now confirm that all power in the Cross Street area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

Sent by Kevin at 19:01 -

We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://UKPN.short.gy/PSR
 
If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

I appreciate your continued patience this evening. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Kevin at 17:43.

Sent by David at 22:11 - Hi David here from the messaging team.  I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Stanley Avenue NR31 7 area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected faulty piece of electrical equipment at the local substation, which our engineers have replaced.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is David - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

I know that power being off may be especially worrying for you as we head later into the evening, but our field teams work 24 hours so I'll let know further news as soon as it comes in.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 20:28 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 00:14 - We have restored power to all 2575 properties in the BN16 2 area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. Our control room has been able to restore all power remotely around the unplanned faulty underground equipment

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 23:44 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is faulty underground electrical equipment that initially interrupted power to 2575 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 625 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 03:30-04:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://UKPN.short.gy/STOP to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 02:23 -H i David here again. We can now confirm that all power in the East Dulwich Estate area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by David at 01:50
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the East Dulwich Estate area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 03:30-04:30 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams.. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by David at 01:39.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by 11kV UG Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 22-FEB-2026 05:30.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 04:10. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
